All static findings are false positives triggered by markdown formatting syntax and documentation placeholders. The skill contains no executable code, no network calls, no file system operations, and no command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Manage CAPA Processes and Root Cause Analysis
content.value_statement: This skill provides expert-level guidance for managing Corrective and Preventive Actions within Quality Management Systems. It offers systematic root cause analysis techniques, corrective action planning frameworks, and effectiveness verification procedures for regulatory compliance.
actual_capabilities: Lead CAPA processes from initiation through effectiveness verification
Apply root cause analysis techniques including 5 Whys, Fishbone, and Fault Tree Analysis
Develop corrective and preventive action plans with clear deliverables and timelines
Monitor CAPA performance metrics and generate trend analysis reports
Ensure regulatory compliance with ISO 13485, FDA 21 CFR 820.100, and EU MDR requirements
Integrate CAPA activities with risk management and quality system processes
limitations: Does not replace formal quality management software or tracking systems
Does not provide legal or regulatory certification services
Does not execute actual CAPA workflows or update external databases automatically

use_cases.title: CAPA System Implementation
use_cases.description: Establish systematic CAPA processes for handling quality issues and maintaining compliance readiness.

use_cases.title: Audit Preparation Support
use_cases.description: Document CAPA processes and root cause analysis to demonstrate inspection readiness for auditors.

use_cases.title: Process Improvement Tracking
use_cases.description: Track corrective actions and verify effectiveness of implemented improvements across production lines.

prompt_templates.title: New Quality Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: A critical quality defect was identified in our product line. Help me initiate a CAPA process including preliminary investigation steps and selection of appropriate root cause analysis methodology.

prompt_templates.title: Root Cause Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: The same quality issue has recurred after initial corrective action. Help me conduct a thorough root cause analysis using Fishbone Diagram methodology to identify contributing factors.

prompt_templates.title: Effectiveness Review
prompt_templates.prompt: We need to verify the effectiveness of a completed CAPA. Guide me through the effectiveness verification process including data collection methods and success criteria assessment.

prompt_templates.title: Regulatory Compliance
prompt_templates.description: Prepare our CAPA documentation for an upcoming FDA inspection. What records and documentation should we have readily available?
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare our CAPA documentation for an upcoming FDA inspection. Help me organize our CAPA records, investigation reports, and effectiveness verification documentation to demonstrate compliance with 21 CFR 820.100 requirements.

output_examples.input: Help me start a CAPA for a customer complaint about product malfunction.
output: **CAPA Initiation Checklist**:
â€¢ Document trigger event with date, product, lot number, and complaint details
â€¢ Conduct preliminary investigation to gather facts
â€¢ Assess significance using severity and impact criteria
â€¢ Determine CAPA necessity based on regulatory requirements
**Recommended RCA Method**: Fishbone Diagram (multi-factor problem)
**Immediate Actions**: Contain product, notify quality team, preserve evidence

output_examples.input: Guide me through 5 Whys analysis for a process deviation.
output: **5 Whys Analysis Framework**:
1. Define Problem Statement: What specifically occurred?
2. Ask First Why: Why did this happen?
- Document immediate cause
3. Ask Second Why: Why did the immediate cause exist?
- Look for contributing factor
4. Continue Until Root Cause: Repeat 5 times or until actionable root cause identified
5. Verify Root Cause: Confirm with data and evidence

output_examples.input: What metrics should we track for CAPA performance?
output: **Key CAPA Performance Metrics**:
â€¢ CAPA Cycle Time: Days from initiation to closure
â€¢ First-Time Effectiveness: Percentage effective on first implementation
â€¢ Recurrence Rate: Percentage of issues that recur
â€¢ Overdue CAPA Rate: Percentage exceeding timeline
â€¢ Investigation Quality: Thoroughness score of root cause analysis
**Monthly Reporting**: Status reports for operational management
**Quarterly Reporting**: Trend analysis for senior leadership

best_practices: Document all CAPA activities contemporaneously with clear reference to evidence and data sources
Select root cause analysis methodology based on problem complexity, not personal preference
Verify CAPA effectiveness using objective data before closure, not just completion of actions
anti_patterns: Jumping to solutions without completing thorough root cause analysis
Closing CAPAs without objective evidence of effectiveness
Treating symptoms rather than addressing underlying systemic root causes

faq.question: What regulatory standards does this skill address?
faq.answer: Covers ISO 13485 Clause 8.5.2-8.5.3, FDA 21 CFR 820.100, and EU MDR Article 10.9 requirements.

faq.question: How is this skill different from quality management software?
faq.answer: This skill provides expert guidance and frameworks. Actual CAPA tracking requires dedicated QMS software.

faq.question: Can this skill help prepare for FDA inspections?
faq.answer: Yes. Provides documentation organization guidance and regulatory requirement reference for inspection readiness.

faq.question: What root cause analysis methods are included?
faq.answer: 5 Whys, Fishbone Diagram, Fault Tree Analysis, Human Factors Analysis, and FMEA methodologies.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with other RA/QM skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Works with risk-management-specialist and quality-manager-qms-iso13485 for comprehensive compliance.

faq.question: How often should CAPA effectiveness be verified?
faq.answer: Effectiveness should be verified within defined timeframes per your QMS procedures, typically 30-90 days after closure.
